title: Code Scans
content: ### Source Code Security Audit: Using Source Code Security Audit Mixeway can automatically run manage SAST scans by the API and jenins plugin. **_Avaliable integrations:_** ### Info Code Scanning is built from 2 objects - CodeGroup which may or may not contain child applications (CodeProjects). It is designed so one product which is build from multiple microservices could be still logically linked. ### Discovery In order to use Code Scan plugin each CodeGroup has to be previously configured - Configuration->Source Code -> Add Code Group. Fields like GIT repo and git username and password are obligatory to run the scan. ### Integration goal * Configure scan - in scope of Microfocus Fortify it require additional software - use troubleshooting and contact us for the details * Run scan (scheduled, enabled manualy and REST API) - in scope of Microfocus Fortify it require additional software - use troubleshooting and contact us for the details * Load vulnerabilities ### Recommended usage Ideal place to run Source Code Security Audit is before merge request (or pull request) is being done. Merge decision should be based on results of a test ### API usage: - Scan Execution ```shell script curl -X PUT \ -H 'apiKey: {apiKey}' \ https://localhost/api/sast/{projectId}/create/{groupName}/{projectName} Response: HTTP 201 {"status":"OK|Qeueed","requestId":"ffffffff-ffff-ffff-fffffffffff"} ``` - Scan progres check ```shell script curl -X GET \ -H 'apiKey: {apiKey}' \ https://localhost/api/vulns/{projectId}/{codeGroup}/{codeProject} Response: HTTP 200 {"commitId":"iuahsidh71d21dwa","result":"Ok|Not Ok", "running:":true, "inQueue":false, "vulnManageResponseList":[]} ``` Where: - Project has to be created (projectId avaliable) - CodeGroup and CodeProject has to be created (groupName and projectName ) in the most scenarios groupName=projectName - ApiKey is generated
